overview.about: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France. It is located in the north-central part of the country, along the river Seine. Paris has an estimated population of 2.1 million people within its city limits, and its metropolitan area is home to over 12 million people, making it the most populous urban area in the European Union. Paris is widely regarded as one of the world's most beautiful and romantic cities, known for its art, culture, fashion, and cuisine.

extra_activities.title: Visit the Eiffel Tower
extra_activities.description: No trip to Paris is complete without visiting this iconic landmark, which offers stunning views of the city.

extra_activities.title: Explore the Louvre Museum
extra_activities.description: One of the world's most famous museums, the Louvre is home to an extensive collection of art and artifacts, including the Mona Lisa.

extra_activities.title: Take a Seine River Cruise
extra_activities.description: This is a great way to see the city's landmarks from a different perspective, including Notre-Dame, the Eiffel Tower, and the Musée d'Orsay.

extra_activities.title: Visit the Palace of Versailles
extra_activities.description: This grand palace was once the center of political power in France and is now a popular tourist attraction, with its lavish gardens and opulent interiors.

extra_activities.title: Explore Montmartre
extra_activities.description: This historic neighborhood is known for its charming streets, bohemian atmosphere, and stunning views of the city from the top of the hill.

events.hover_info: You arrived at Charles de Gaulle Airport.
You must go to Hotel Le Meurice at 228 Rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris, France
Eiffel Tower Summit Access and Seine River Cruise

activity_data.activity_name: Eiffel Tower Summit Access and Seine River Cruise
activity_data.address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France
activity_data.description: Experience Paris from two different perspectives with this combination tour. Get panoramic views of the city from the summit of the Eiffel Tower and then cruise along the Seine River, taking in the sights from the water.

sections.title: BANKING AND CURRENCY
sections.information: In Paris, the official currency is the Euro (EUR). Most banks and ATMs accept major credit cards and travelers checks. Currency exchange services can be found at airports, train stations, and major tourist areas. It is always recommended to check the exchange rate before making any currency exchange.

sections.title: ELECTRICITY AND PLUG STANDARDS
sections.information: In Paris, the electrical voltage is 220-240V AC, 50Hz. The plug type used is the European standard plug, which has two round pins. It is recommended to bring a universal adapter if your devices use a different type of plug.
